page.title: 03THE RED LION, PRESTON
page.content: The Red Lion is the only public house in Preston.It is a Grade 2 listed building,originally 2 cottages. The premises were first used for selling beer in 1832,being named Lion in 1844. It became known as the Red Lion in 1847.When the brewery planned to ex- pand and change the character of the pub in 1982 the village community raised Â£125000 to acquire the free- hold.A company was formed with 97 shareholders and a board of directors was elected.68 shareholders were directly involved with an extensive refurbishment programme.It reopened on 17 March 1983 amidst considerable TV and press coverage.It is the focal point of the village and used for special village occasions and shoot lunches.
